books.title: A House of Gentlefolk
books.author: Ivan Turgenev
books.summary: After his marriage fails, a Russian nobleman returns to his family estate and falls in love with the devout daughter of his cousin, who encourages him to reconcile with his wife.

books.title: The Sea Hawk
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: A Cornish gentleman becomes a Barbary corsair and seeks vengeance on the jealous half brother who betrayed him.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
books.author: Carlo Collodi
books.summary: A wooden puppet comes to life and goes on adventures.

books.title: Jurgen
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: Jurgen, a pawnbroker and “monstrous clever fellow,” is sent on a witty and parodic magical journey in search of true love.

books.title: Arms and the Man
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A humorous examination of human hypocrisy and war’s stupidity in the midst of the Serbo-Bulgarian war.

books.title: Through the Looking-Glass
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: In a follow-up to her adventures in Wonderland, Alice finds herself in a mirror image of the whimsical land where she becomes a queen in her own right.

books.title: Pimpernel and Rosemary
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A famous journalist is drawn into the intrigues of two Eastern European nations in the aftermath of World War I.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Borough Treasurer
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: When a retired detective is found murdered, two business partners in a small Yorkshire town become the prime suspects.

books.title: The National Being
books.author: George William Russell
books.summary: An Irish writer presents his vision of an independent Irish nation.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Thomas Gray
books.summary: A collection of poems by Thomas Gray.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Moon Maid
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young man travels to the moon with a group of companions and discovers that it’s inhabited; in subsequent centuries, reincarnations of the same man deal with an invasion of the Earth by the malevolent inhabitants of the Moon.

books.title: Continental Op Stories
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A collection of short stories about an unnamed agent of a detective agency in the early 1920’s.

books.title: The Pilgrim Kamanita
books.author: Karl Gjellerup
books.summary: An Indian merchant’s son sets on a pilgrimage after a life of love, loss, business, and pleasure, and unknowingly relates his tale to the Buddha.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
